task.title: Editing a message hub by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can edit endpoints, connection policies, messaging policies, and message hubs by using the update command.

context.p: You can edit a message hub by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to edit a message hub, see .
For more information about the components that make up a message hub, see .

step.cmd: To edit a message hub, enter the following command:
step.info:
The command must be capitalized as shown, and must use the double quotation marks as shown.
update MessageHub "Name=hubName" "Description=description"Where:
hubName Specifies the name of the message hub you want to edit.
description Specifies a description for the message hub.

taskbody.example: The following example shows editing a message hub that is called testHub to update the description: update MessageHub "Name=testHub" "Description=A new description" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
